title: Vaccines
cleaned_text: COVID-19 vaccines are one of the most important tools to end the COVID-19 pandemic. A safe, effective, no-cost vaccine is available to everyone in Del Norte County. Getting vaccinated can help prevent you from getting seriously ill from the virus and protect those around you as well. [https://www.cvs.com/immunizations/covid-19-vaccine](https://www.cvs.com/immunizations/covid-19-vaccine) Rite Aid Pharmacy (Moderna) Via Appointment [https://www.riteaid.com/covid-19](https://www.riteaid.com/covid-19) Safeway Pharmacy (Moderna) Via Appointment on Wednesdays only [https://www.safeway.com/vaccinations/home](https://www.safeway.com/vaccinations/home) Walgreens Pharmacy (Pfizer, Moderna, Janssen) Walk-ins (1-800-925-4733) Walmart Pharmacy (Moderna) Walk-ins during pharmacy hours. [https://www.walmart.com/cp/immunizations-flu-shots/1228302](https://www.walmart.com/cp/immunizations-flu-shots/1228302) Many healthcare offices offer Covid-19 vaccinations. Talk to your Doctor. Vaccines given through Public Health are free to all residents of Del Norte County. Vaccines given through provider offices and pharmacies may be billed to insurance. The California Department of Public Health (CDPH) offers a digital COVID-19 vaccine record, available at [myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov](http://myvaccinerecord.cdph.ca.gov). You can use this tool to request a digital copy of your COVID-19 vaccine record. If you would like a hard copy of your vaccine record or if you need a replacement vaccine card, you can call Public Health at 707-464-0861. If you are unable to get to a vaccine appointment and need in-home vaccination services, please call 707-464-0861 to
